metadata.title: CVE-2018-8741 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
A directory traversal flaw in SquirrelMail 1.4.22 allows an authenticatedattacker to exfiltrate (or potentially delete) files from the hostingserver, related to ../ in the att_local_name field in Deliver.class.php.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-8741` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

squirrelmail - 2:1.4.23~svn20120406-2+deb8u3build0.14.04.1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: squirrelmail package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.4.23~svn20120406-2+deb8u3build0.14.04.1').
